org.tiian.lixa.xta

Class Transaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tiian.lixa.xta.Transaction

  • public class Transaction
extends java.lang.Object
    The Transaction class implements the methods necessary to manage XTA transactions, like commit and rollback. This class does not have a public constructor because its factory is createTransaction and there would be no usage of a Transaction object that has not been created by a Transaction Manager factory.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void branch(java.lang.String xidString)
      Create a new branch of the transaction represented by xid in this transaction object; the global transaction has been previously started
      void commit()
      Commit the current transaction
      void commit(boolean nonBlocking)
      Commit the current transaction; this version of commit method is used to implement the Multiple Applications Concurrent Branches Pseudo Synchronous pattern.
      void enlistResource(javax.transaction.xa.XAResource xaRes, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String identifier)
      Enlist the resource specified with the transaction associated with the target Transaction object.
      protected void finalize()
      Release the C native object when Java object finalization is executed
      XtaXid getXid()
      Return the XID associated to the current transaction.
      void recover()
      Explicitly open and close all the enlisted resource to look for recovery pending transaction in the LIXA state server.
      void resume(java.lang.String xidString)
      Resume the transaction represented by xidString in this transaction object; the transaction has been previously suspended with suspend
      void rollback()
      Rollback the current transaction
      void start()
      Start a new 2 phase commit transaction: this version of start method can be used only if the transaction is not branched by 2 or more applications
      void start(boolean multipleBranches)
      Start a new 2 phase commit transaction: this version of start method is necessary only if the transaction will be branched by other applications by mean of calling branch method.
      void suspend()
      Suspend the transaction represented by this transaction object; the transaction can be resumed with resume at a later time

    • Method Detail

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
        Release the C native object when Java object finalization is executed
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object

      • enlistResource

        public void enlistResource(javax.transaction.xa.XAResource xaRes,
                  java.lang.String name,
                  java.lang.String identifier)
                    throws XtaException
        Enlist the resource specified with the transaction associated with the target Transaction object.
        Parameters:
        xaRes - The XAResource object associated with the Resource Manager
        name - The name of the Resource Manager associated to the XAResource, for example "PostgreSQL"
        identifier - A string to distinguish the specific Resource Manager instance. Use distinct identifier for different Resource Manager instances, schema owners and so on: uniqueness is essential to avoid undesired and/or wrong automatic recoveries
        Throws:
        XtaException

      • getXid

        public XtaXid getXid()
              throws XtaException
        Return the XID associated to the current transaction. It calls the C native interface and it's the factory that MUST be used to create XtaXid objects.
        Throws:
        XtaException - if the underlying native C functions returns an error condition

      • start

        public void start(boolean multipleBranches)
           throws XtaException,
                  javax.transaction.xa.XAException
        Start a new 2 phase commit transaction: this version of start method is necessary only if the transaction will be branched by other applications by mean of calling branch method. For single applications, use the version without parameters.
        Parameters:
        multipleBranches - must be true only for transactions that will span more applications and it will be followed by a call to branch method
        Throws:
        XtaException
        javax.transaction.xa.XAException

      • start

        public void start()
           throws XtaException,
                  javax.transaction.xa.XAException
        Start a new 2 phase commit transaction: this version of start method can be used only if the transaction is not branched by 2 or more applications
        Throws:
        XtaException
        javax.transaction.xa.XAException

      • commit

        public void commit(boolean nonBlocking)
            throws XtaException,
                   javax.transaction.xa.XAException
        Commit the current transaction; this version of commit method is used to implement the Multiple Applications Concurrent Branches Pseudo Synchronous pattern. For all the other use cases, the method without non Blocking argument is suggested.
        Parameters:
        nonBlocking - boolean value: true = xa_prepare will not block the caller, false = xa_prepare will block the caller; the option is used only for multiple branch transactions
        Throws:
        XtaException
        javax.transaction.xa.XAException
        See Also:
        LIXA Reference Guide / Developing Application Programs using XTA

      • commit

        public void commit()
            throws XtaException,
                   javax.transaction.xa.XAException
        Commit the current transaction
        Throws:
        XtaException
        javax.transaction.xa.XAException

      • resume

        public void resume(java.lang.String xidString)
            throws XtaException,
                   javax.transaction.xa.XAException
        Resume the transaction represented by xidString in this transaction object; the transaction has been previously suspended with suspend
        Parameters:
        xidString - serialized identifier of the transaction that must be resumed
        Throws:
        XtaException
        javax.transaction.xa.XAException

      • suspend

        public void suspend()
             throws XtaException,
                    javax.transaction.xa.XAException
        Suspend the transaction represented by this transaction object; the transaction can be resumed with resume at a later time
        Throws:
        XtaException
        javax.transaction.xa.XAException

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • recover

        public void recover()
             throws XtaException,
                    javax.transaction.xa.XAException
        Explicitly open and close all the enlisted resource to look for recovery pending transaction in the LIXA state server. In normal condition, this is not necessary, because the same happens when start, resume and branch are called
        Throws:
        XtaException
        javax.transaction.xa.XAException
